questions.question_text: Which religion  developed in Haiti as a syncretism of West African belief systems and Catholicism, and revolves around belief in spirits called Lwa or Loas? This religion also gave rise to a similar belief system in Louisiana.

What extinct genus  with a distinctive ‘sail’ formed from bony spines connected to its vertebrae has a name derived from the Greek for ‘two measures of teeth ’? Though often portrayed as a type of dinosaur in popular culture, these creatures were actually early synapsids, closely related to the ancestors of modern mammals.

What form of transport  names the ‘problem’ in an influential thought experiment put forward by Philippa Foot , and given its name by Judith Jarvis Thomson , which asks whether it is moral to sacrifice one person in order to save others?

translations.mandarin: Yǒu guǐ diànchē nántí Norwegian: sporvogns problemet

questions.question_text: Imprisoned for several years for a crime he didn’t commit, Edmond Dantès is the title character of which 1844 adventure novel  by Alexandre Dumas?

translations.mandarin: Jī dù shān ēn chóu jì  Norwegian: Greven av Monte Cristo

questions.question_text: Molecular oxygen , or O 2, is the most common allotrope of elemental oxygen. It is a diradical molecule, resulting from its ground state electron configuration with two electrons occupying degenerate molecular orbitals to form what type of spin state ?
questions.answer: triplet  (or triplet  state, spin triplet , triplet  oxygen)

questions.question_text: Tuttomundo  in Pisa is one of the last outdoor works by which American artist  who began his career in the 1980s graffiti scene in New York City  and who died from AIDS - related complications in 1990?

Georges Cousineau  was an 18th-century maker of what kind of musical instrument , which was in vogue at the time because it was Marie Antoinette’s instrument of choice? In 1782 , Cousineau came up with a 14 -pedal version of this instrument, which allowed users to play in all keys, and is an important predecessor to the modern concert version , which has seven pedals .

In mathematics, what name is given to a number  that can be used to measure a continuous, o ne-dimensional quantity , or in other words, correspond s to a point along a line? The  set of these numbers is denoted R.

‘Tortues’ (‘Tortoises’), ‘L’Éléphant’ (‘The Elephant’), ‘Aquarium’ and ‘Fossiles’ (‘Fossils’) are movements taken from what humorous musical suite  of 14 movements written for two pianos, a chamber ensemble , and a glass harmonica?

translations.mandarin: Dòngwù Kuánghuān Jié  Norwegian: Dyrenes karneval

accept: Le Carnaval des animaux  by Camille Saint -Saëns

questions.question_text: Resulting in sweeping reforms to the political system and wider society, the Meiji [may - jee] restoration was an event of 1868 that saw the re -establishment of Imperial rule in which country , ending the control of the shoguns?

In 2025, the United States implemented a series of tariffs against most of its trading partners. One territory that received a lot of attention at this time was which external Australian territory  that was tariffed despite being uninhabited? This territory consists of one larger island and a smaller archipelago over 4,000 kilometres from Perth in the southern Indian Ocean.  Your answer should contain the name of both the island and the archipelago .
questions.answer: Heard  Island and  McDonald  Islands  (accept Heard and McDonald  Islands; prompt

questions.question_text: In 1949, the CIA began a decade -long covert effort against which country ’s government when they installed a pro -American colonel, Adib Shishakli, who lasted for four years before the Ba'ath Party overthrew him? Ba'athism was established in this country by intellectuals such as Michel Aflaq before spreading to its eastern neighbour.

Louis I of Hungary became the King of Poland in 1370 following the death of which king , Louis’ uncle, who is considered one of the most successful Polish monarchs? This king acquired much of Ruthenia, passed many judicial and military reforms, allowed Jews to settle in Poland , and founded the Jagiellonian University.

translations.mandarin: Kǎqímǐrì sānshì, Kǎqímǐrì dàdì Norwegian: Kasimir III den store

questions.question_text: Jean Valjean spends 19 years in prison for stealing some bread in which 1862 novel  by Victor Hugo?

What type of number  is defined as one that can be expressed as a fraction of two integers where the denominator must not be zero? The set of these numbers is denoted by the letter Q and while all of these numbers are real, not all real numbers fall into this set.
Written around the year 1200, which epic poem  by Shota Rustaveli is an allegory for the reign of Queen Tamar and is considered the masterpiece of medieval Georgian literature?
questions.answer: The Knight in the Panther’s Skin  (or Vepkhist'q'aosani )

translations.french: Le Chevalier à la peau de panthère ,
translations.german: Der Recke im Tigerfell , Der mit
translations.polish: Rycerz w tygrysiej skórz e, Witeź w

questions.question_text: Candomblé is a syncretic religion sometimes likened to vodou that developed in which South American country  where enslaved Africans incorporated their own beliefs into the state religion of Roman Catholicism?

Another surprising tariff imposed by the United States in 2025 was on the British Indian Ocean territory, the only occupants of which are American service personal on the island of Diego Garcia. Diego Garcia is part of which archipelago ? The government of the United Kingdom has announced it will transfer sovereignty of this archipelago to Mauritius.
What is the name of the series of domed rocks , or bornhardts , in the southern part of Australia’s Northern Territory that give their name to a national park alongside Ulu ṟu?

Following the Meiji Restoration, the Japanese government gradually abolished what class of soldiers , who had previously been employed by lords? Although many of them accepted their new status, some of those who were unhappy launched the failed Satsuma Rebellion.

Although a common ancestry was long suspected, a 1986 paper by Jacques Gauthier theorized that modern birds were, in fact, a type of ‘dinosaur’, leading to a major upheaval in dinosaur phylogenetics classification. Distinct from  the bird -hipped dinosaurs ( Ornithischia ) and the s auropod s; which of the three major dinosaur clades (groups) , with a name meaning ‘beast -footed’, did Gauthier classify birds under?

translations.mandarin: Shòu ji ǎo yà mù Norwegian: Theropoder

questions.question_text: The ship of which Greek hero appears in an influential thought experiment described by Plutarch – and repopularised by Thomas Hobbes – which questions whether an object is the same object after having all of its original components replaced over time?

The diradical triplet oxygen has two unpaired electrons. The electrons remain unpaired and spin -parallel to form the triplet or S=1 state, in accordance with which set of rules for electron configuration  named after a German physicist?
What is the four -letter name  associated with Jean -Michel Basquiat’s early street art persona? This graffiti was created with collaborator Al Diaz and appeared all over Manhattan in the late 1970s.

The new Meiji government introduced the ideology of shinbutsu buri , in which Buddhist idols were destroyed as part of a separation with which religion , which came to be the basis of an imperial cult? This religion revolves around supernatural figures called kami , and is considered the main indigenous belief system of Japan.

translations.german: Shinto ismus  Mandarin:  Shéndào , Chēng shén dàojiào

questions.question_text: The title character of which dastan , or epic story, of the Oghuz Turks is a white - bearded sage who is said to have lived for 295 years and attended the election of the Great Khan? This 8th -century collection of stories includes the tale of Basat and a one - eyed giant called Tepegöz, and is considered an important part of the culture of Azerbaijan and parts of Central Asia.
questions.answer: The Book of  Dede Korkut  (or Kitabi -Dədə Qorqud , Kitaby Dädem Gorkut ; Dede

translations.mandarin: Xiānzǔ Kuòěrkùtè shū Norwegian: “Dede Korkut s bok”

questions.question_text: The saung , or saung -gauk , is an arched harp regarded as the national instrument of what Asian country ? The ‘t'na’ is a variant of the saung , played by the Karen (or Kayin) people in this country.

‘Il vecchio castello’ (‘The Old Castle’) , ‘Balet nevylupivshikhsya ptentsov’ (‘Ballet of Unhatched Chicks’) , and ‘Izbushka na kuryikh nozhkakh ’ (‘The Hut of Hen's Legs’) are movements in what piano suite , made up of ten total movements, and later adapted for the orchestra by other composers?
questions.answer: Pictures at an Exhibition  by Modest Mussorgsky (or Kartínki s výstavki  –

translations.german: Bilder einer Ausstellung  Mandarin:  Zhǎnlǎn hu ì zhī huà

questions.question_text: Although he was the founder of the Jagiellonian University, Casimir the Great was the final king of which royal dynasty  that had ruled Poland since the reign of Mieszko I [MYESH -ko] in 960? Branches of this dynasty survived much longer in Masovia and Silesia.

Many of the earliest known thought experiments – such as that of Achilles and the tortoise – are collected in the ‘paradoxes’ of which 5th-century BCE philosopher from Elea , whose works are known to us through the writings of Plato and Aristotle? This man’s paradoxes were largely devised as a defence of his teacher, Parmenides.

translations.mandarin: Āilìyǎ de Zhīnuò Norwegian: Zenon  fra Elea

questions.question_text: Which syncretic religion  developed among the Afro -Cuban population and involves belief in spirits called orishas ? This religion is known for its use of animal sacrifice.

translations.mandarin: Sàtàil ǐā jiàopài, shèng zhě zhī

questions.question_text: The triplet oxygen electronic configuration results in molecular oxygen exhibiting which type of magnetism , meaning it becomes weakly attracted to applied magnetic fields?

In 1953, the CIA and British intelligence gave future prime minister General Fazlollah Zahedi $75,000 and tasked him with forming a military secretariat to mount a coup in which country , leading to the overthrow of an elected prime minister and the strengthening of the rule of a hereditary monarch?
What word  is used to describe the unit i, which is defined as being the square root of -1, and any number formed from the multiplication of i and a real number?

What enormous inselberg  is the most prominent outcrop of the Antioquia batholith in Colombia? A popular tourist attraction, it can be climbed via a 708 -step staircase and it overlooks a namesake reservoir.
questions.answer: El Peñón de  Guatapé  (or La Piedra  del Peñol , accept either underlined part)

questions.question_text: Pterosaurs, including the Pterodactyl  and Pteranodon , are commonly confused as a type of ‘dinosaur’, despite being their own distinct clade. What pterosaur genus , with a name derived from mythology, is the largest known animal capable of self -powered flight, with an estimated wingspan of up to 25.8 meters (85 feet)?

translations.mandarin: Fēngshén yì lóng sh ǔ, Yǔ shí

questions.question_text: Which overseas collectivity of France  was initially hit with a 99% ‘reciprocal tariff’, later reduced to 50%, as its export of seafood to the US greatly outweighed its imports? Only 5,800 people live in this territory located very close to Newfoundland.

translations.mandarin: Shèng Píāiěr hé Mìkèlóng  Norwegian: Saint -Pierre og Miquelon

questions.question_text: Haring’s spontaneous drawing style is contrasted with what style of graffiti  used by artists such as Tavar Zawacki, Banksy, and Shepard Fairey? This style uses an art technique that allows the artwork to be applied very quickly and repeatably.

translations.mandarin: Múb ǎn pēn hu à, záo mà ,

questions.question_text: Which 670 -metre tall inselberg in Namibia  has been dubbed the ‘Matterhorn of Namibia’ due to its distinctive shape?

Sometimes confused with dinosaurs alongside other marine reptiles such as plesiosaurs, which large predatory reptiles  of the Cretaceous are thought to be most closely related to monitor lizards and snakes? The earliest known specimens of this group were mistaken for whales, and they have a name derived from a European river.
questions.answer: mosasaur s (or Mosasaur idae; accept Mosasauru s; from Maas

questions.question_text: In the Book of Samuel,  which figure is depicted as a young shepherd and skilled harpist who would play the instrument to soothe the ailing King Saul?  In Ethiopian tradition, Menelik I is said to have brought this king’s harp to Ethiopia, where it gave rise to an instrument called the begena.
During the planning for the 1954 Guatemala coup, the CIA enlisted help from which major American corporation  that felt threatened by President Arbenz’s land reform programme?
questions.answer: United Fruit  Company (accept United Brands  Company ,

questions.question_text: Alexandre Manette is a doctor who spends 18 years in the Bastille in the build up to the French Revolution after he learns the secrets of an aristocratic family in which 1859 novel by Charles Dickens ?

translations.french: Le Conte de deux cités , Le Conte de
translations.german: Eine Geschichte aus zwei Städten  Mandarin:  Shuāngchéngjì

questions.question_text: The name of what language  describes the  ‘room’ in the name of an influential thought experiment put forward by John Searle that attempts to show that we should not assume consciousness on the part of a computer regardless of how humanlike it might behave?

translations.mandarin: Zhōngwén  fángjiān  Norwegian: det kinesiske  rommet

questions.question_text: Casimir’s successor, Louis, was succeeded in Hungary by his daughter Mary, but in Poland he was succeeded by which other daughter  who became the first woman to be crowned as monarch in Poland in her own right? Her marriage to Władysław [vwa - DISS -wav] II Jagiełło [ya-GYEH-wah] was preceded by the Union of Krewo  [KREV -oh], and led to Lithuania’s conversion to Christianity and began a union of the crowns of Poland and Lithuania.

translations.mandarin: Yǎdéwéijiā Norwegian: St. Hedvig  av Polen

questions.question_text: ‘Åses død’ (‘The Death of Åse’); ‘Solvejgs sang’ (‘Solveig’s Song’); and ‘Bruderovet / Ingrids klage ’ (‘The Abduction of the Bride / Ingrid’s Lament’) are titles of pieces that make up what larger composition , originally written as incidental music for a play and later compiled into two suites?

The concept of orishas  in Candomblé and Santería is derived from that of the spirits of the same name in the belief system of which West African people ? The religion of these people, who primarily live in southwestern Nigeria, is sometimes called Ì ṣẹ̀ṣe.
Which medieval epic poem  in four parts i s considered the national epic of Armenia and tells the story of a hero who repels  an invading Arab force?
questions.answer: Daredevils of Sassoun  (or Sasna cṙer, Sassountsi Davit )

translations.french: David de Sassoun , Les enragés de

questions.question_text: Singlet oxygen, with all electron spins paired, is the first excited state of molecular oxygen. Unlike triplet oxygen, the more reactive singlet oxygen can participate in what class of reactions  by acting as a dienophile  [dye -EEN -oh-file] ?

‘Z českých luhů a hájů’ (‘From Bohemia’s Woods and Fields’), ‘Vyšehrad ’ (‘The High Castle’), and ‘Vltava’ (‘The Moldau’) are titles of symphonic poems that make up what larger work ? The six pieces were originally written to be played individually but are commonly performed together, as one work in six movements.
questions.answer: Má vlast  by Bedřich Smetana (or My Fatherland , My Country , My Homeland )

translations.mandarin: Wǒ de Zǔguó Norwegian: Mitt fedreland

questions.question_text: In 1958, the CIA sponsored a coup that failed to overthrow the government in which country , where they  suppo rted a rebel government known as the PRRI, whose leaders included Ahmad Hussein and Maludin Simbolon ? Following the successful coup in this Asian country in 1965, the CIA supplied lists of communists to the army, leading to mass killings that particularly target ed communist party members.
Which 725-metre tall inselberg  is situated in the town of Madalla, about 10 kilometres west of Nigeria’s capital Abuja? An iconic feature of the landscape, it is featured on the 100 naira note.
What kind of number  is defined as having the form  a + bi [b i] , where a and b are both real numbers and i is the imaginary unit of root -1?

Under the Tokugawa shogunate, eastern and western Japan operated different systems of coinage . In 1870, Emperor Meiji’s government began the introduction of what currency , that remains in place to this day.

translations.mandarin: Rìyuán , Rìběn yuán , Rìbì  Polish:  Jen

questions.question_text: Which Norwegian territory  around 600 kilometres northeast of Iceland was hit with 10% tariffs alongside Svalbard? This territory has no permanent inhabitants and is named after a Dutch seafarer.
Which French graffiti artist  began using stencils to create large -scale images of a rodent on the streets of Paris in the early 1980s and is considered the ‘father of stencil graffiti’?

Written in medieval Greek, which 12th -century work  is considered the only surviving Byzantine epic poem? Its title is the epithet of the hero, Basil, and refers to the frontier warriors in eastern Anatolia, the very edge of the Byzantine empire.
questions.answer: Digenes Akritis  (or Digenis Akritas , Digenes Akrites )

translations.mandarin: Díjínísī·Ākèl ǐtè Polish:  Bazyli Digenis Akritas

questions.question_text: Jadwiga vied for the Polish crown with a Holy Roman Emperor with what name ? That man had married Jadwiga ’s sister Mary, however the lords of Lesser Poland did not wish to have a German sovereign and Jadwiga ’s claim was successful. A later Polish king with the same name was known as ‘the Old ’ and his son, also with this name, was the first ruler of the Polish –Lithuanian Commonwealth after the Union of Lublin .
questions.answer: Sigismund  (or Zygmunt ; accept Sigismund  of Luxembourg, Sigismund  I the Old,

questions.question_text: In a story from mythology  of which island  does a supernatural race of beings called Fomorians steal a harp, Uaithne  [OO -an-yuh] , (and/or the harpist, depending on the translation) from the great god Dagda?

translations.german: Irische  Mythologie , Irland  Mandarin:  Ài'ěrlán  shénhuà

questions.question_text: Rodion Raskolnikov is a law student who is eventually imprisoned in Siberia for the murder of a pawn broker and her sister in which 1866 novel by Fyodor Dostoevsky ?
questions.answer: Crime and Punishment  (or Prestupleniye i nakazaniye )

questions.question_text: Siddhartha Gautama  is the name of the figure central to which major world religion ?
What is the name of the village  in the  Navsari District, Gujarat  that was the destination of Gandhi’s Salt March in 1930?
La Fée aux Choux  (The Fairy of the Cabbages ) is an 1896 short film, generally considered to be the first film directed by a woman . Who was its director?
Corazon Aquino  was the president of which country  between 1986  and 1992?
Urbain Le Verrier  and John Couch [kooch] Adams  independently predicted  the existence of which planet in our Solar System  in the 1840s?

Graham Island and Moresby Island are the two largest islands in which archipelago  in British Columbia, f ormerly known as the Queen Charlotte Islands, that is separated from the mainland by the Hecate Strait ?
